titleStmt.title: The vindication of the law: so far forth as scripture and right reason may be judge, and speedy justice (which exalts a nation) may be advanced. VVherein is declared what manner of persons Christian magistrates, judges, and lawyers ought to be. / By Iohn Cooke of Graies Inne, now chief justice of the province of Munster, 1652.
titleStmt.author: Cook, John, d. 1660.

titleStmt.title: The vindication of the law: so far forth as scripture and right reason may be judge, and speedy justice (which exalts a nation) may be advanced. VVherein is declared what manner of persons Christian magistrates, judges, and lawyers ought to be. / By Iohn Cooke of Graies Inne, now chief justice of the province of Munster, 1652.
titleStmt.author: Cook, John, d. 1660.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Matthew Walbancke, and are to be sold at his shop at Graies Inne Gate,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
